metadata.feature_description: Provides hierarchical folder tree navigation with expand/collapse functionality and path breadcrumbs

steps.action: Navigate to Assets panel and click on My Website
steps.expected: Folder tree should display with root-level folders
steps.actual: Folder tree displayed showing folders: Badges, Groups, Images, RenamedSecureFolder, Templates, TestFolder01, Users and various files

steps.action: Click on Images folder to expand/navigate into it
steps.expected: Should navigate into Images folder showing its contents
steps.actual: Successfully navigated into Images folder, showing subfolders (MoveMe, Publisher) and image files with breadcrumb HOME > IMAGES

steps.action: Click on Publisher subfolder to navigate deeper
steps.expected: Should navigate into Publisher subfolder showing its contents
steps.actual: Successfully navigated into Publisher folder, showing files (Azure.png, cavalier-tv-thumb-120.png, logo.gif, etc.) with breadcrumb HOME > IMAGES > PUBLISHER

steps.action: Click the back button (arrow icon) to navigate back from Publisher folder
steps.expected: Should navigate back to parent level or root
steps.actual: Back button navigated all the way back to root Assets view showing portal options (Global Assets, My Website, Test Portal 2)

steps.action: Navigate to My Website > Images > Publisher folder
steps.expected: Should be at Publisher folder with full breadcrumb path visible
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to Publisher folder with breadcrumb showing HOME > IMAGES > PUBLISHER

steps.action: Click on IMAGES in the breadcrumb to navigate directly to Images folder
steps.expected: Should navigate directly to Images folder, skipping Publisher level
steps.actual: Successfully navigated directly to Images folder with breadcrumb showing HOME > IMAGES, contents showing subfolders (FolderToMove, MoveMe, Publisher) and files

steps.action: Click on HOME in the breadcrumb to navigate to root folder
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to Home folder with breadcrumb showing HOME, contents showing all root-level folders and files

steps.action: Navigate through multiple folder levels: Home > Images > Publisher (3 levels)
steps.expected: Should successfully navigate through multiple folder levels with correct breadcrumb
steps.actual: Successfully navigated through 3 levels (Home > Images > Publisher) with breadcrumb correctly showing all levels

steps.action: Navigate through Home > Groups > 10 folder hierarchy
steps.expected: Should successfully navigate through folder hierarchy
steps.actual: Successfully navigated through Home > Groups > 10 with breadcrumb showing HOME > GROUPS > 10, folder contains icon-wiki-32px.png file

steps.action: Click on sort dropdown to view available sort options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed with three options: Last Modified, Date Uploaded, Alphabetical (currently selected)

steps.expected: Folders and files should be reordered by last modified date
steps.actual: Successfully sorted by Last Modified, folder order changed to: Templates, Groups, RenamedSecureFolder, Users, Images, Badges (different from Alphabetical order)

steps.expected: Folders and files should be reordered by upload date
steps.actual: Successfully sorted by Date Uploaded, folder order changed to: Images, Templates, Users, Badges, Groups, RenamedSecureFolder, Test-Folder_With.Special Chars 2026
Groups folder displayed with single subfolder named '10'

observations: The folder tree navigation provides a clean, intuitive grid-based UI for navigating folders and files
Breadcrumb navigation allows direct jumping to any parent level in the folder hierarchy
Three sort options are available: Alphabetical, Last Modified, and Date Uploaded - all working correctly
Folders display with folder icons, while files show thumbnails where available
The back button returns to the root Assets view (portal selection) rather than one level up
Special characters in folder names are supported (e.g., 'Test-Folder_With.Special Chars 2026')
Code suggests GetFolderPath API returns folder ancestors for breadcrumb rendering (confirmed by test observation)
Secure folders display with a lock icon indicator (observed on RenamedSecureFolder)
